Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph shows a genuine display of the Canadian flag across Niagara Falls on Canada Day in 2019.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the display by showing a maple leaf shape, which is not part of the actual light displays on Niagara Falls.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to verify the authenticity of the photograph.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph is genuine without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that the photograph has been digitally edited or manipulated, as confirmed by experts.
